column2: or La Seyne is a commune in the Var department in the French Riviera . It is part of the agglomeration of Toulon
column3: and is situated adjacent to the west of this city.

column1: It owed its importance to the shipbuilding trade
column2: the Société des Forges et Chantiers de la Mediterranée having here one of the finest shipbuilding yards in Europe (it is a branch of the larger establishment at Marseille)

column1: In recent years the town has moved from its traditional industries to tourism. The docks previously used have had extensive work and now comprise a park
column2: marinas and a new (2010) hotel overlooking Toulon and the marinas.

column1: The population is diverse in origins and the outer suburbs are undergoing a transformation with old multi storey apartments being replaced with modern developments. La Seyne has a railway station
column3: on the line from Toulon to Marseille.
